results.title: Jungle patrol
results.creator_credit: Tom Gurr and Commonwealth Department of Information
results.brief_description: An account of a jungle patrol by eight Australian soldiers in the Dumpu to Shaggy Ridge area of New Guinea during WWII. The film unit flew with the Australian patrol to the Ramu Valley and marched with it to the outpost of Shaggy Ridge in the Finisterre Range. The film shows the difficulties and dangers of the campaign - rain, mud swamps, tangled jungles and steep mountains - with the cameraman taking all risks under fire from the enemy. The soldiers were: Pte A.N. McGregor, L/Cpl A.C. Pierson, Pte R.F.C. Northcott, Pte A.B. Graffin, Pte M.J. Driver, Cpl R.A. Box, Pte J.H. Adams, Pte E. Barmby. Photography by J.W. Trerise and William Carty.

results.title: Jungle Fighters at Canungra School
results.brief_description: Forty miles south-west of Brisbane, at Canungra, troops of the 2nd Battalion are being turned into skilled jungle fighters. After an initial toughening course, training is done on a course consisting of obstacles the soldier could normally expect to find in jungle warfare. As the jungle affords many hiding places for the enemy, a course in snap-shooting is given. Training also includes detection of booby traps and trip wires, security precautions, sneaking, ability to gain information from objects left by the enemy indicating his path, position and strength, learning to take advantages of trees, tree climbing and assault training.

results.title: Jungle bunny [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Zok Nyste, Fotini Manikakis and AFTRS
results.brief_description: With the phrase “I’ll take that one”, African tribesman Mbuti Matabuiki Lobiko finds himself sharing a household with Australian housewife Clarissa Penfold and her family. A humorous fable that looks at the way we exploit each other both consciously and unconsciously, across all levels of our relationships - cultural, national, racial, sexual and personal. Cast includes Renny Augustine, Genevieve Mooy and Neil Fitzpatrick.

results.title: Jumping the gun
results.creator_credit: Jane Schneider, Murray Fahey and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Combining style from film noir, TV advertising imagery, Mills and Boon romance and Sydney ghetto realism, this is a farcical look at how one woman’s “morning after” fantasy turns into a tragi-comic nightmare.

results.title: Jumping for Joy
results.creator_credit: Stanley Russell, Educational Films of Scotland and Thames and Clyde Film Company
results.brief_description: An introduction to trampolining. A semi-instructional film, it shows the growing popularity of the five basic landing positions, and shows suitable exercises for people of different ages. A section on the value of trampolining in rehabilitation work is also included.

results.title: Julius Caesar: the rise of the Roman Empire
results.creator_credit: William Deneen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The role of Julius Caesar in transforming Rome from a city Republic to a world empire; the arrest of power from the Senate by the triumvirate; Caesar’s military conquests culminating in his emergence as the single ruler of the Empire. He inaugurated reforms of the legal system, economy and public works. In 44 BC Julius Caesar was murdered.

results.title: Julius Caesar: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Peter Seabourne and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: A talented English company performs key scenes in this abbreviated version which, however, preserves the sense of tragedy of the full-length drama. Brief narrative bridges connect the scenes, which offers the first-time reader an opportunity to acquire a grasp of the main themes and action, and enrich his understanding and appreciation of the play.

results.title: Judoka
results.creator_credit: Josef Reeve, Bernard Devlin, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The unusual story of a young Canadian athlete, Doug Rogers, who developed, in Japan, a talent for judo that led him into competition for the world championship at the Tokyo Olympics and subsequent competition at the Pan-American Games. The film shows the intensive judo training Rogers took at a Tokyo college, as well as glimpses of his life in Japan.

results.title: Judo
results.brief_description: Gives details of the sport of Judo which has become most popular in the western world in recent years. Judo is the Japanese art of self-defence or unarmed combat and its specialised techniques are a co-ordination of mind and body in a highly refined and effective way.
